#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Improve Verbal Communication Skills
#Text=Effective verbal communication is necessary in almost every field of life .
#Text=You need good communication to do everything from performing your job properly to ensuring your romantic relationship functions smoothly .
#Text=Many people struggle with this skill , but it is not too difficult if you remember a few important details .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Preparing Yourself
#Text=Make some mental notes first .
#Text=You should always be prepared for what you are going to talk about .
#Text=It can be very helpful to jot down some ideas ahead of time so you do n't forget some of your key points , or just to help you figure out what you want to say .
#Text=Practice in the mirror .
#Text=All skills take practice , and good conversation skills are no different .
#Text=If you have a big speech to give or an important conversation coming up , it can be helpful to practice it with yourself in the mirror beforehand .
#Text=This way , you 'll at least have a run through in your mind already before you attempt the real thing .
#Text=And it will help you work out any possible problems that may arise ( in your argument , stumbling over words , etc. ) .
#Text=Read a lot .
#Text=The more you know about a topic , the better you 'll be at talking about that topic .
#Text=Reading will help you enhance your knowledge and will boost your diction in the process .
#Text=Speaking in Informal Settings
#Text=Make eye contact .
#Text=This technique is so important , but many people forget about it when speaking to people .
#Text=It shows attentiveness and interest in what 's being said .
#Text=Increased eye contact is associated with credibility and dominance , so it is important to maintain solid eye contact when speaking to someone .
#Text=Smile .
#Text=Something as simple as a smile can completely change the way a conversation goes .
#Text=Smiling helps us form and sustain interpersonal relationships , so it is an essential part of communicating with others .
#Text=Practice open/relaxed body language .
#Text=Your body language should be relaxed .
#Text=This means that you should not cross your arms or stiffen your body .
#Text=Keeping your arms open invites reciprocated communication rather than sending a message of being closed and unreceptive .
#Text=Avoid harsh tones .
#Text=Your tone of voice can be an immediate deciding factor for how someone interprets what you say .
#Text=You could say a phrase in a positive tone and someone would interpret it positively , while saying the same thing in a harsh tone would lead to a negative interpretation .
#Text=Do n't get off on tangents .

#Text=Verbal communication is different than other forms of communication in that it is easier to get off topic , which can make it hard to remember what the conversation was really supposed to be about .
#Text=This is confusing for your listener .
#Text=So , stay on topic .
#Text=Show confidence .
#Text=Before you start talking , you should be confident that you can achieve the goal you have for engaging in this conversation .
#Text=If you are unsure of yourself , your conversation partner will be less receptive to your message .
#Text=Speaking in Public/Formal Settings
#Text=Be concise and clear .
#Text=Do not add irrelevant elements in your speech .
#Text=Get to the point and say what you mean so that your listener can respond accordingly .
#Text=Do n't get off on tangents .

#Text=Verbal communication is different than other forms of communication in that it is easier to get off topic , which can make it hard to remember what the conversation was really supposed to be about .
#Text=This is confusing for your listener .
#Text=So , stay on topic .
#Text=Be considerate .
#Text=Always include a consideration for your audience/listeners when planning out a speech or thinking about an upcoming conversation .
#Text=You do n't want to say something that might be taken the wrong way or offend your audience .
#Text=Make eye contact .
#Text=Making and maintaining eye contact is crucial when speaking to people , whether one-on-one or in a group setting .
#Text=It shows attentiveness and interest in what 's being said .
#Text=Increased eye contact is associated with credibility and dominance , so it is important to maintain solid eye contact when speaking to individuals or to a group .
#Text=Note :
#Text=When you are addressing a crowd , you should not look at one for more than 5 seconds .
#Text=This is too personal/intimate for a group setting .
#Text=Smile .
#Text=Practice smiling while you speak .
#Text=This is especially important when addressing groups of people because it is a simple way to build a foundational relationship with people you may not have any one-on-one interaction with .
#Text=Smiling helps us form and sustain interpersonal relationships , so it is an essential part of communicating with others .
#Text=Pace yourself .
#Text=Do not speak in hurry , as it will make the listener think that you are confused or that you do n't know what you 're talking about .
#Text=Speak slowly and confidently .
#Text=Avoid sarcasm .

#Text=From the standpoint of a listener , a sarcastic remark requires a process of decoding and interpretation before they can understand what has been said , what has been meant , and if the two are the same .
#Text=Try to incorporate humor .
#Text=Everyone likes to laugh , so humor can be a great way to lighten up your conversation and make your listener more receptive to your message .
#Text=Note : Of course , you should avoid vulgar or inappropriate humor to avoid offending your listener .
#Text=Practice open/relaxed body language .
#Text=Your body language should be relaxed .
#Text=This means that you should not cross your arms or stiffen your body .
#Text=When addressing groups of people , it is important to use your hand gestures to emphasize your message .
#Text=Try not to be overly animated , but do n't keep your arms stiff at your side either .
#Text=Be sure of yourself .
#Text=Your audience wo n't put any stock in what you say if you act unsure or timid .
#Text=You have to show your listeners that you believe in your message before you can expect them to believe you too .
#Text=Video
